headline: Moderate Dem accused of trying to 'confuse' GOP primary voters with mailers tying candidate to Trump
sentences: Gottheimer isnt the only Democrat who appears to be throwing up primary smokescreens trying to tie Republicans to Trump  the Pennsylvania gubernatorial race is seeing television ads from the presumptive Democrat nominee, state Attorney General Josh Shapiro, targeting GOP state Sen. Doug Mastriano as "one of Donald Trumps strongest supporters."

"The fact that Josh Gottheimer feels the need to spend tens, if not hundreds of thousands of dollars, to try putting his thumb on the scale of the opposing partys primary speaks volumes about how desperate he is given his track record of loyally supporting Joe Bidens anti-energy and inflationary spending policies," Szymanski said.

"Now Josh, who consistently presents himself as a bipartisan, common sense Democrat whos above the fray, is using liberal special interest money to wage his own Putin-style disinformation campaign to confuse Republican primary voters about who the true conservative leader in this race is."

veteran Nick De Gregorio said it "is clear who Josh Gottheimer wants to win this Republican primary  and its not the guy who served his country in four tours overseas and is now calling on him and others to sell off their stock portfolios to clean up Washington."

"Its dead wrong  and if Josh is the statesman he claims to be, he will immediately stop any spending in the CD5 Republican primary," he added, calling on Pallotta "to immediately disavow Gottheimers attempt to put his thumb on the scale in this race."

Many are theorizing the 2022 midterm elections will see major Republican gains, meaning Gottheimer is in for a challenge against whoever gets the GOP nomination.
Pallotta lost to Gottheimer by seven points last election, but those seven points could be in play come this years midterm elections as the national attitude toward Democrats sours.
He knows that the cost of food and gas, along with the Biden administrations abject failure to secure the border and support our cops is indefensible here," De Gregorio said.
A moderate House Democrat in New Jersey was accused of trying to "confuse" Republican primary voters with mailers tying a GOP candidate to former President Trump.
Gottheimers mailers are already having the same effect in New Jersey, predicting the Garden State Democrat wants a rematch against Pallotta, his 2020 opponent.
Rep. Josh Gottheimers, D-N.J., campaign sent mailers to Republican voters highlighting Republican candidate Frank Pallottas 2020 endorsement from Trump.
"Frank Pallotta is too much like Trump," the mailer selling Gottheimer as a "problem solver" looking to find "commonsense, bipartisan solutions" reads.
"But heres a message for you, Josh, man-to-man: I will never stop fighting for the future of this country against gutless cowards like you."
New Jersey Republican Party executive director Tom Szymanski torched Gottheimer over the mailers in a Monday statement to Fox News Digital.
"For years, Democrats like Josh Gottheimer talked ad nauseam about Russian interference in our elections," De Gregorio said.
The ads targeting Mastriano spurred many to think that he was the Republican Shapiro wants to run against.
Trump has yet to endorse a Republican candidate in the 2022 primary race for New Jerseys Fifth District.
"No amount of meddling or money spent will save Gottheimer from the voters this November," he added.
"He wants to end vote by mail and he led the fight to audit the 2020 election," the TV ad says.
Neither Pallotta nor Gottheimers campaigns responded to Fox News Digitals request for comment.

"If Mastriano wins, its a win for what Donald Trump stands for."
